website_summaries.verdict: Compact and portable but needs different balls to work and is inaccurate. Opt for something better.
pros: Compact and easy to assemble machine lobs balls at 10-second intervals
Indicator light and height adjustment are nice features
cons: The machine only works well with after-market balls
Accuracy is an issue if machine is not steady

customer_reviews.title: 10 yr old son loves it....
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for a month now with no issues using it. We bought wiffle balls with the holes all around and it works perfectly with the unit. Having the heavier balls seems to make the balls come out a lot more consistent than the balls that came with it. Attached a video to show how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: KMB72

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny with different balls!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews I decided to purchase and also to get some Jugs Poly baseballs. I tested the balls it came with. The stock balls were very erratic. The jugs balls are much more consistent. I'd say on average 8/10 are strikes. Pretty great machine for the money. Talked two other dad's into getting for their kids pretty easily once they saw some videos of my son using it. Here's the Jugs balls I got. Others may work similar styled as long as diameter is the same. This machine works off friction between two rubber spinning donuts just like a mini Jugs pitching machine.
customer_reviews.author: Julie C

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves this!
customer_reviews.text: For a fraction of the cost of a dog launcher, my border collie loves this machine. It took a while to learn the steps (grab ball, drop ball, drop ball in feeder, wait, retrieve ball) but oh so worth it. We use this indoors and out. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Initially everyone loved this, but I found it has to be on level ground. I.e. Concrete to get secure footing as it tips over very easily. Wish I could buy attachment to raise height of this machine. It's probably great for younger kids who are shorter. Maybe I can set this on a outdoor ottoman or something.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for practice. My son is 11. He has played baseball since he was 4. I was tired of throwing balls to him for batting practice. Even though you can’t use real baseballs in this it’s still great for batting practice. Eventually we will invest in a real one for baseballs but for now this works well. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KristiWhitaker

customer_reviews.title: Great pitching machine
customer_reviews.text: For the price this does what it is supposed to do. Gave it to our grandson for his 6th birthday. He loves it. Also gave him two sets of the "Jugs Poly Baseballs." The pitching machine's angle can be adjusted and it uses 4 D size batteries.
customer_reviews.author: shopgal92019

customer_reviews.title: No power
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY a nice spring day in upstate New York and my kids were so excited to use this. Santa brought this back in December so the return window is closed. Very disappointing when we get it set up and it doesn’t shoot any balls out. Terrible feeling to see disappointment in your kids faces.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Needs design overhaul
customer_reviews.text: 1) Eats batteries quickly 2) I don’t expect perfect strikes every time (just like baseball), but this is wildly inaccurate. 3) It struggles to consistently feed, often getting a ball stuck or trying to shoot 2 simultaneously. 4) It broke after a few uses. I like the idea, but their design is tragic 🤦‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Winter

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t seem to hurt when the ball smacks your dog in the face
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy! So much cheaper than the dog versions and works just as well! We use it inside and outside.
customer_reviews.author: HBoros

customer_reviews.title: dogs love chasing these balls but chewed them up pretty quick
customer_reviews.text: dogs love chasing these balls but chewed them up pretty quick...get some Jugs Vision-enhanced green poly baseballs as they work in the pitching machine also
customer_reviews.author: hoghunter

customer_reviews.title: DOA. Glad i didnt tell my 3yr old so only 1 kid was disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Put batteries in and it didnt turn on. Checked the batteries even tho they were new and they tested full charge. Put the batteries back in and checked over the connections. Seemed to sit right touching each connection and still wont turn on. Happy that i only told my 6yr old that it was coming and not my 3yr old.. so to disappoint the older more rational one was a slight win.
customer_reviews.author: Cogito ErgOsUm

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.  Fun for the whole family.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 7 year old along with a red bat and extra wiffle balls. We put in 4D batteries and it works great. It was super easy to set up and including adding batteries we were playing in minutes. Glad we got the 8 pack of balls to go with it. Didn't realize the colorful wiffle balls that we also purchased would be way too big to use in the pitching machine. Lots of fun and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy not accurate or consistent.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for disappointing my son. The balls come out with an accuracy of about 3’ left to right and up and down. Balls are all over the place. The three height adjustments don’t stay in their notches and the top just flops around. Don’t buy this. It’s a waste of time and money. I knew I should have spent more.
customer_reviews.author: PTR

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs also!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for active dogs as well! We have a 4yr old mix of border collie, german shepherd, and queensland. He is a very active breed!! This is our 3rd or 4th one and he loves it. He loves chasing the balls. Every once in a while he will try to put his bone or another toy for the machine to toss out to him lol. Eventually the dog slobber will ruin the mechanism or the ball will be dented with his bite and the machine wont work. But we love it to help with his energy level and exercise!!
customer_reviews.author: mugs

customer_reviews.title: My unit seemed used and sold as new
customer_reviews.text: The unit is ok. Sometimes it gets stuck. Other times it sends out 2 balls at the same time. Good for a beginner. My 8 year old is happy with it. What I am not happy about is the fact that it looks like mine was a return product. No original box. Ball were just tossed in the box. Nothing had plastic. I paid for a new item not a return or open box.
customer_reviews.author: all girls

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for 4-5 yearolds to develop hand eye coordination
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for 4-5 yearolds to develop hand eye coordination. Adult supervision is key to adjusting the speed and angle of ball release. Awesome fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I had to make an internal adjustment (weaken a spring) but once I did that it works great. It throws the pickleball about 25 feet or ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for pickleballs. I had to make an internal adjustment (weaken a spring) but once I did that it works great. It throws the pickleball about 25 feet or so, not fast but still good for practice. Can't beat the price! Four stars because it didn't work well out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: CA Guy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for practice!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for practice! My 7 year old loves it. 1st year playing baseball so he needs a lot of practice. This little unit helps him develop his batting skills. I like that it lights up when the ball is about to be thrown. It has different positions so it helps with highs and lows. The only thing I don't like is that it only brings 6 balls. We lost 2 in our back yard. I will be buying more baseballs as we use this little guy 2 or 3 times a week... that's how much my son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Pineda

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Box completely torn and the toy is snapped into pieces in the box. Unacceptable
customer_reviews.author: Emily Miller

customer_reviews.title: POS Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This product is crap. Flimsy plastic with plastic balls the dog bit right through first use and cut her gumb. It fell apart when she brought the ball back and dropped it in the top. I should have returned it but I got it for my terrier for Xmas and she was staying with my mom 100 miles away to keep her company and alert the neighbor if she fell. I would not recommend this product but would warn not to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Good quality machine
customer_reviews.text: For the price...I was not expecting much. But I am impressed. This machine pitches the balls well from about 40 feet away. It only takes a ball or 2 to get it lined up correctly. We use a rubber home plate so my grandsons know where to stand. We have used it lots of times these past 7 pandemic months and it still operates fine. Batteries are lasting too. The only warning I have is... unless you use this on a large open field, expect to buy lots more balls. They will disappear quickly into trees, bushes and neighbors' yards.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Ridley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed with this. As was my dog :( He watched me open the box with excitement, I put the batteries in and it threw the ball. He was getting in to it but then all of the sudden it stopped working. I couldn’t figure out what was wrong so I had to return it. I was sad for my dog because he just knew it was for him.
customer_reviews.author: Newly Wed

customer_reviews.title: Sad face
customer_reviews.text: My son was really excited to play baseball this summer and this was supposed to help him get some batting practice on his own whenever he wanted it. I bought extra balls to fill it up but sadly it only worked for two days before losing all of its power. I’m guessing one of the motors went out or just stopped working properly because it now only shoots the ball about two feet. Clearly not enough distance for batting practice. I had high hopes for this even with the low prices but I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: R Mountain

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful.. best money spent
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful.. best money spent! My son, who will be 7 next month, has so much fun with this! People have complained that the pitches aren't perfect... but come on! Got this for $30! Its not going to be a professional grade pitching machine.... if that's what your looking for it's going to definitely cost more than that!! Haha. Perfect for the price!
customer_reviews.author: ang valencia

customer_reviews.title: Margot, my daughters dog,
customer_reviews.text: the miniature Australian shepherd loves chasing the balls out of this thing. Daughter said it works fine, but Margot has a bit of trouble "grabbing" onto the balls. I bought some 'wiffle' balls thinking she could get her teeth in one of the 'holes' and grasp it easier, but they don't fly out of the thing smoothly. Just a shade tight. And I bought the size recommended by reviewers. But no go. Now the balls that came with it come out smooth and are perfectly fine, but my hunt is still on for a wiffle ball that fits in the nozzle. Still would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Schilling

customer_reviews.title: No Original Box
customer_reviews.text: Nothing in the description indicated this item was used, but it showed up without an original box and the balls were wrapped in a shopping bag from Kohl’s. It works just fine and that’s all that matters to my 7 year old and his puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Suutopia

customer_reviews.title: Broken in two days.
customer_reviews.text: It broke within a few days. It will shoot off one or two balls and then stop. The gears are somehow not working the way they should. It was so disappointing. For the price this was fantastic, it does exactly what I wanted it to do... but it broke almost immediately and this was with gentle handling. I gave it a chance despite the numerous reviews stating similar things. 👎🏼
customer_reviews.author: MayTheSchwartzBeWithYou

customer_reviews.title: worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Considering the low price, well worth the money. Came almost all assembled and works good. We double dipped, my 6 year old uses it for batting and catching practice and we also use it as a dog ball launcher for the dog, which saves our arms.
customer_reviews.author: boomer806

customer_reviews.title: So so batting machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap alternative to going to the batting cage but leaves much to be desired. It often throws 2 balls at a time which is very annoying. My 10 year old son likes it and at least we can practice in the driveway, but don’t expect a flawless performance from it. I did also order the extra wiffle balls that so many reviewers mention, which Really helps to keep him hitting and less time chasing balls in between sessions.
customer_reviews.author: FlyLkNEgl

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product comes apart easily every time you try to move it. The balls roll everywhere. Most of the time is spent putting it back together again. Hard to find the right angle. This product was good for about 5 minutes of mediocre fun. Don't waste your money. Just throw the ball to your child.
customer_reviews.author: baseball mom

customer_reviews.title: Not just for kids!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our grandson. Initially, it wouldn't work. I found the problem and repaired one of the 4 "D" size battery loads. Once working, we all had fun with this thing. It's no joke. We bought the recommended extra balls. The 1st pitch is always a dud but, it can be fun for all ages. We had 3 generations (7 yrs old to 64 years old) playing with this.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: ... spot every time but it is a lot of fun and works well
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't pitch in exactly the same spot every time but it is a lot of fun and works well, pitches them fast and hard, don't stand to close and get hit, it hurts
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a p.o.s., wildly inaccurate and kills batteries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Marine

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Still works after three months. The red light doesn't come on right before the pitch it comes on the pitch is launched so it doesn't help much. In the end I think just throwing my own pitches to the kids is less of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: K G

customer_reviews.title: Best backyard toy
customer_reviews.text: This pitching machine is so much fun to use for kids and adults! It is built quite sturdy and the balls are not made of cheap plastic either. I would suggest ensuring younger kids under 5-6 yrs to be watched carefully so they don't run in front of the pitching machine and can also react quickly is the ball is coming towards their body. This is a toy that gets a lot of attention especially during small family gatherings
customer_reviews.author: Tapper26

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, the balls are shot out very inconsistently, ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the balls are shot out very inconsistently, even after only a couple times of use. One pitch might be right down the middle, the next pitch high and outside, the next pitch barely getting over the plate. I give it 2 stars instead of 1 because if anything, it helps train the batter on how to wait for the right pitch. Unfortunately, I don't want my kid to get one hittable pitch out of every 8. I'd look elsewhere for more consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Kojak

customer_reviews.title: No Speed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter for Christmas. I read the reviews but didn't read far enough to discover that the balls are not released with enough speed to allow for worthwhile practice. No matter how we adjusted it, the balls wouldn't "pitch" far enough for my granddaughter to take a swing. We tried both the balls included and the balls recommended. Neither worked well at all.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Forse

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Don't love this. Accuracy and durability just isn't quite there to keep my 7 year old interested. Need more balls for the machine and can't find where to buy them. Whiffle balls don't work. They move through the machine but don't go far.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Hadley

customer_reviews.title: Not consistent shooting strength
customer_reviews.text: It’s a new concept but it seems like it’s not consistent how the ball comes up. One can be high while the next can be low. Wish it comes with power plug in option.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: Don't spend the money
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before purchasing and realized there were some less favorable reviews. However, that didn't prepare me for what junk this thing is. It doesn't pitch for a while, then it pitches two at once. It has never pitched in a stroke zone yet despite a lot of repositioning. I even bought the Jugs balls recommended by another reviewer. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: crap!! Assembled it. Loaded it up, shoots in a wild pattern when it did shoot. Shot once over head, then 3 minutes later grounder...then 2 at a time...crap,.....DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Joi O.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This piece of junk stopped working 30 minutes after we opened it up and put fresh new batteries in. At first I thought maybe it was going through batteries quicker than I had anticipated. But we put in new batteries and it just doesn't work now. The red light comes on nothing else happens. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: The Most Economical Fun With Your Dog!
customer_reviews.text: Brodie says: “The best toy ever! My mom fires up this thing & I get in my exercise! Great for the days she slacks up on my walks.” Purchase the recommended extra Jugs balls. Watch-my dog’s a chewer & cut his tongue on the ball. Launch 1 at a time to take it away quickly.
customer_reviews.author: LVgrl

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth the $29.99 bucks
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this thing. I missed the return window and am now stuck with it. The accuracy of the machine is subpar. Shoots a groundball, over your head, then maybe by the last ball you'll get something somewhere in the strike zone. The proximity indicator ( to let the machine know you're there and ready for a pitch) is weak and you have to get close to the thing for it to recognize you're there; kind of defeats the purpose of a pitching machine. I guess I'll just put this in a toy donation bin somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Purple K

customer_reviews.title: Arrived cracked, low quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and arrived cracked! Not good quality... no option from seller to send replacement plastic part. Would of at least hoped I could use it for a bit before it cracked, not shipped already cracked.
customer_reviews.author: Kalel

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 year old son. He loves it. When you first put in new batteries, the pitches come out pretty hot, but they slow down a little as the batteries degrade making them a little more manageable for my 5 year old. Biggest drawback is that it moves alot when it is on a smooth surface. I placed a small dumbbell behind it to keep it in place. I would also like to see it have a plug in option, because 4 D batteries burn out pretty quickly with heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and helpful
customer_reviews.text: Great teaching aid for beginners. My son decided he wanted to give baseball a try, but has never swung a bat. This machine was awesome for the price. He is able to see "live" pitching and learn fundamentals of swinging with this. I do recommend the Jugs poly balls, they tend to fly straighter than the cheapos that come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! But also buy the other brand of wiffle ball every other comment states.
customer_reviews.text: Purchase the other balls as everyone else claims. The balls that come with it are highly inaccurate and pitch much faster. The first original ball actually hit my son in the forehead where as the other brand had been right down the middle each time. Luckily, it didn’t hurt him. Still a very good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Got this for our 7 year old. Works well ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our 7 year old. Works well. The only difficulty is at first trying to determine how far away to stand from the machine. We also purchased extra balls that were identical to what came with the machine - Franklin Sports Aero-Strike Plastic Baseballs-Pack of 8 (70-mm).
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: HIT !!!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS WAS A GIFT FOR MY GRANDSON AND IT'S AWESOME !!!! EASY TO ASSEMBLE ,RUNS ON BATTERY, AND GIVES ME EXERCISE CHASING THE BALLS !!! LOL !!!! JUST FILL IT UP SET THE ANGLE FOR HIS HEIGHT AND LET'S PLAY BALL!!!! HIS BATTING HAD IMPROVED A LOT SINCE GETTING THIS. IT'S WELL WORTH THE PRICE AND THE FUN !! I CAN EVEN HIT !!!
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves to chase balls and this works well for her.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Would be better if the balls didn't constantly get stuck
customer_reviews.text: This machine was easy to assemble but the balls frequently got stuck and needed to be pushed along. As several reviewers recommended, I purchased the Jugs balls too and they worked a little better than the ones that came with it. Since I gave this as a gift I'm not sure if it got better over time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Addict

customer_reviews.title: Good fun for the dog to.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephews birthday. Actually their dog retrieved more balls then my nephew hit. So it was really fun for both...lol
customer_reviews.author: Barb Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I modified this to so my dog can play fetch by himself. He gives it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fun for times I'm too tired to pitch for the ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought my kid was too old for this (9) as he's been playing for a while. He loves it, fun for times I'm too tired to pitch for the 1000th time! Great fun!
customer_reviews.author: Cheap Mama Chick

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price !
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is GREAT ! My 8 year old Granddaughter had a blast, this WILL shoot out the same diameter plastic whiffle balls that I did have on hand, so Grandpa can run 15 balls through before we have to pick any up. Perfect for the backyard or park. I recommend the you go ahead and buy the Amazon "D" cell batteries that come in a pack of 12, as this will take 4 batteries and they arrived regular post earlier than the machine.
customer_reviews.author: James Vogel

customer_reviews.title: D batteries required!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 2 year old son and found out very fast that it might be a little advanced for him but i can help him swing at the balls for now just to get him used to it. The machine definitely puts the ball out at a good rate. Surprising to me. A little pricey but meh, My son is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Best Birthday Gift Ever
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for grandsons in early baseball years. It really pitches those balls out there and has three height adjustments to account for their differing sizes.
customer_reviews.author: P.Dinhoble

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not worth the money! I have no idea how this product is earning good reviews. It pitches the ball ALL OVER the place. Very inconsistent. I attempted to return it but the company did not bother to respond.
customer_reviews.author: mark vest

customer_reviews.title: If it arrives in a plain brown box,, ship it right back!!
customer_reviews.text: Description says “item arrives in packaging that shows what’s inside.” Uhm, no. I received a unit that was in a plain brown box. Clearly it was a used unit and the pitches were so inconsistent. Nice try Amazon. Back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap for a reason
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for right? The price is right but the product is not good. The balls are very light and cheap feeling. I've read that heavier balls help, but why should I pay more? Worse than that it cause inconsistency in the pitches. Also the first pitch or two are always a little off, it even explains that in the instructions. I've read good reviews on this and I just don't know how, it's junk and it looks and feels like junk.
customer_reviews.author: Nick R.

customer_reviews.title: Pitcher help for parents who have no skills, lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Helping my son practice hitting is hard, I needed something to help us that wasn't too expensive. This fit the ticket perfectly when you can't always make it to the batting cages. The accuracy isn't perfect but it is 80% better than my pitching skills. I like that it is lightweight and runs on batteries. It was simple to put together. My son loved this as a Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Allison N

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not kid friendly. Not very durable and is constantly falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly good for batting practice
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use for batting practice indoors, when it's cold/raining/dark outside. It looks like a toy, but it's good for simulating soft toss. We use it for that, with my son batting into a net in the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Did not meet expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap for thg he price, $30. Used four D batteries without provision for external power. Only feeds lightweight plastic baseballs well. Too much effort to feed. Rating questions don't match failure to meet expectations.
customer_reviews.author: H. R. Norckauer Jr.

customer_reviews.title: My son loves
customer_reviews.text: My 7 yr old loves this. We bought the better balls to go with it (mentioned in other reviews). He plays potter league in a pitching machine league and this has really helped him!
customer_reviews.author: charlene

customer_reviews.title: Reminds me of Rick Ankiel
customer_reviews.text: Super erratic! You can get a nice down the middle pitch or some sweet chin music. I had to return this after my kids and their friends complained of getting beaned too much. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Win

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Fast!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the speed this thing pitches. I assumed it was going to just lob the ball up, but it fired out with impressive speed. We've had a blast playing with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: G-Lanz

customer_reviews.title: Dad, let the machine do the work
customer_reviews.text: compact and effectively "lobs" balls for kids to learn to bat. Probably best for the eye-hand coordination of at least an average 5 y/o.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Z

customer_reviews.title: THE PERFECT GIFT
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift for our great grandson. He’s 5 years old & is playing T ball. Best little gift ever. He can practice by himself or with a parent. He really enjoys this & so do his parents.
customer_reviews.author: J J

customer_reviews.title: Should have passed..
customer_reviews.text: Was broken out of the box, on-off switch was non-existent. Kids were super excited, & I didn’t want to throw in the towel, so pulled the base apart and installed my own switch from extra stuff I had in the garage. Good to go right? WRONG, the plastic is so cheap it can bearly stand up on its own weight with waffle balls on it. Adjustment constantly moves, placing the ball all over with inconsistency. I had a gut feeling it wouldn’t be good, but the short video made me try it.. so yes, I took the bait. 🤦‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nick Holt

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing shot me in the face first try! 😂🤣 the power was amazing! My son loves it! Just wish we could figure out where the balls going tho! Sometimes it shoots hard sometimes two come out. But worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Erika Doo

customer_reviews.title: Play ball!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this looked like a great product for my grandsons for Christmas ! I have researched and this is a great price. It was bought for a four year old. Pretty simple to put together and comes with extra balls and you can buy more balls if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie B

customer_reviews.title: Great batting and catching practice!
customer_reviews.text: Our 8 year old grandson loves this. He is just starting Little League and he uses it to practice both batting and catching.
customer_reviews.author: PhR

customer_reviews.title: Good trainer
customer_reviews.text: Works good for training. Has some accuracy issues but that is a plus. If you play ball not every pitch is going to be perfect. So it teaches them to swing at the good and not the bad. My 7 yr old loves it.
customer_reviews.author: MJR

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Does what it is supposed to do. I did find the same issues as some of the other reviewers with accuracy and repeatability. Try staking or weighting it down to keep it from moving when grabs and throws a ball. The hi-vis wiffle balls that others recommended are better than the balls provided by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very inconsistent pitches, inaccurate and moves around
customer_reviews.text: First couple pitches were accurate but couldn’t get a consistent pitch after. Not great when trying to teach my 5yo. Easy to assemble, my 5 yo put it together by himself
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Wildly Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my 5 year old and machine is virtually useless the pitches are all over the place sometimes short, sometimes over his head and other times outside the strike zone. We gave up on it after trying 3 or 4 times to use.
customer_reviews.author: John Geraghty

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent ball throw. This machine needs temperment on where ...
customer_reviews.text: Inconsistent ball throw. This machine needs temperment on where it will be positioned and set up. Make sure to figure out where and how you need it to sit to throw correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pickleball
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a kid's toy, I thought I'd try it out for Pickleball as the balls are similar diameter. It will actually launch a Pickleball +20 feet - perfect for practicing dink shots in the driveway
customer_reviews.author: Pompano

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Shoots straight 80% of the time but then ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Shoots straight 80% of the time but then again you don't see the same exact pitches in baseball neither. I will admit thought that the construction of the product is pretty flimsy. I'm just waiting for it to break. Not a bad buy though for $20.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin V.

customer_reviews.title: Good play value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy. It enables my son to practice hitting alone and the neighborhood kids think it is cool so it encourages them to come over and play too. My 12 year old put it together himself and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kim W

customer_reviews.title: Worked great the first day
customer_reviews.text: Have to replace the batteries a lot. The pitches are never consistent. Worked great the first day, but hasn't since. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lesli Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: comes in shambles
customer_reviews.text: So did anyone else get theirs in a nondescript cardboard box? I opened it up expecting something I could wrap as a gift but no it really just comes in a blank cardboard box and thrown in there with zero care. Probably is a good product but the presentation is a joke. Can't wait til my nephew asks why I gave him a blank cardboard box.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I got this for my husband for his ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I got this for my husband for his birthday and he loves it. He and our 2 year old son are outside playing with it every evening!
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: This was a really great buy for my kids. The only thing I’d say could’ve been better was the accuracy takes a bit to get adjusted and the fact that it takes regular batteries. Would be way better if it was rechargeable battery or power cord. We did get a lot of use over the summer so I’d recommend giving it a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 6 year old
customer_reviews.text: I got my son these as the next step after t-ball. He loves it but was very scared at first. The power behind the pitch is a revving up that you can hear.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbin

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little machine! My 7 year old loves to play with it in the backyard. Make sure you have plenty of space because these balls can fly!
customer_reviews.author: Kel

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it, but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Fun for the price, the pin that holds the right wheel in place keeps comming out. I constantly have to take apart and fix, lasts a week than comes loose again. When it works my dogs love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: We used this only once before it no longer worked.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Trowbridge

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a faulty product, but this thing jams after EVERY BALL. When it isn’t jammed, the ball falls through and doesn’t make it to the wheels that shoot the ball out. Completely defeats the entire purpose of it. I ordered another kind of balls that were recommended and same thing. There are a few of these on the market—steer clear of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Pen alva

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 days of use
customer_reviews.text: This machine had my boys so excited to get more swing/hitting practice in our backyard. It did require quite a bit of playing around with distance and angles to get the pitches where we wanted them to go but overall they were able to get the bat on the ball and have fun. Unfortunately however, the machine stopped working after only 2 days of use. We attempted a battery switch and made no difference. Though this machine is not expensive, it should last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Boys

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: This would be better I think for a younger kiddo. Mine are 6 & 10. It shoots pretty low so we had to put it on something. It’s not all that strong, and the balls are plastic... that’s probably my fault for not reading the product description properly. But, going back I would put more money into a better machine!
customer_reviews.author: Amy84

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This varies in shooting distance with every ball. One or two balls at regular speed, another flops onto the ground. Really disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: fun for kids
customer_reviews.text: This product could have been better constructed for the price. The on/off switch broke right away and the motor runs nonstop until you pull the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick R. Whelan

customer_reviews.title: this baseball pitching machine works VERY WELL and I highly recommend. I did not expect it to work as ...
customer_reviews.text: Actually, this baseball pitching machine works VERY WELL and I highly recommend. I did not expect it to work as nicely as it does. Recommend for others. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: cindy62

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson to practice batting. The photo of the product led mt to believe it was a metal base but the entire thing is plastic and battery operated. In addition it will not support a regular baseball.
customer_reviews.author: Hewlit

customer_reviews.title: This works great, but get the jugs balls to go with ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great, but get the jugs balls to go with it as they will fly more consistently. This is perfect for my 6 year old son who is learning to hit a pitched ball.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Morning Disappointment!!
customer_reviews.text: This was dead out of the box after multiple battery changes the unit would not even turn on. Made cheap and flimsy but the fact that it didn't work was the most disappointing part for my little guy. Thanks Franklin
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Batteries will get expensive
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Works as intended. 1.5 hours on batteries I bought at Harbor Freight. The cost of batteries will soon make the cheaper price irrelivant. Wish I had gotten the more expensive non batteries alternatuve.
customer_reviews.author: Sniffy

product_meta.title: Franklin Sports MLB Electronic Baseball Pitching Machine – Height Adjustable – Ball Pitches Every 7 Seconds – Includes 6 Plastic Baseballs
feature_bullets: 7 second pitches: This electronic pitching machine for kids is a great way to encourage them to practice their batting skills. The ball pitches every 7 seconds for improved accuracy and precision on the field. Assembled height 7.75 x 9.5 x 9.875 inches

Flashing indicator: A flashing red indicator light shows when the ball pitches, making it easy to prepare in your baseball stance. You get all the fun of a batting cage right in the comfort of your own backyard
Height adjustment: The height of this baseball pitching machine is adjustable, making it a great option for developing young athletes. It’s perfect for practicing multiple batting angles and styles

Six balls included: This batting machine includes six white aero strike balls. You should not use regulation baseballs or tee balls with this baseball machine – only use the balls included. The ball shoot can hold upto 9 balls

Improve batting performance: Your child should ideally use a plastic baseball bat with this pitching machine. There’s no better kids’ baseball pitching machine to help them grow and improve as they practice
Note: Kindly refer user manual and installation manual before use

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
